level.text: The District of Columbia Bar Foundation is appointed as the Administrator for the Program.
In implementing the Program, the Administrator shall:
Publicize and provide information about the nature and requirements of the Program to potentially eligible lawyers and law students;
Develop a list of eligible employment;
Establish and publicize application deadlines;
Develop and distribute application forms and informational materials;
Receive and evaluate completed applications;
Determine the eligibility of applicants, their debt, and their employment;
Select participants for the award of benefits;
Determine the level of loan repayment assistance to be awarded;
Award loans in accordance with the criteria stated in this chapter and the Act;
Secure the execution of promissory notes by participants;
Receive and administer funds appropriated for the payment of loan repayment assistance;
Disburse semi-annual loan payments to selected participants;
Verify semi-annually continuing participant eligibility and compliance with service obligations;
Forgive loans made to participants upon the participant’s satisfactory completion of the service obligation;
Develop a schedule for the repayment of loans that are not forgiven and collect the repayment amounts;
Participate in annual financial and management audits of the Program; and
Provide financial and statistical reports concerning the Program as required by the Attorney General.
The Attorney General shall conduct an annual financial and management audit of the Program.
